column2: Eleven minutes to eight. "You're always right; there must be a clock in your head."

When did you next see Dr. Wellesley? "At just eleven minutes to eight." "Where?" "In the surgery." "He came back there?" "Yes." "How do you fix that precise time--eleven minutes to eight?" "Because he'd arranged to see a patient in Meadow Gate at ten minutes to eight. I glanced at the clock as he came in, saw what time it was, and reminded him of the appointment."
